data.text:
By: Lyle W Dorsett

Code: U200606

In December 1956, "The Times" personal columns carried a discreetly worded announcement of the marriage of the author, don and Christian apologist, C.S. Lewis, to an outspoken American divorcee, Joy Davidman. This biography, based on original letters and family papers, tells Joy's story. It was through reading the works of Lewis that she converted to ^Christianity and wrote the letter that was to change the course of her ^life and bring Lewis to a profound yet tragically brief happiness. Harper Collins, 1993, 167p
